metaphor.core: The lifecycle of React components (mounting, updating, unmounting) is metaphorically explained through the 'Circle of Life' from The Lion King, with emphasis on the importance of cleanup functions for managing resources, akin to maintaining the balance of the Pride Lands.

mapping.fictionElement: Mufasa's teachings about the Circle of Life
mapping.reactConcept: Fundamental React render cycle (mount, update, unmount)
Ignoring component updates/missing cleanup in useEffect
Memory leaks and performance degradation from unmanaged side effects

mapping.fictionElement: Simba accepting responsibility/Rain cleansing Pride Lands
mapping.reactConcept: useEffect cleanup function for resource management
Component reusability and complete lifecycle pattern

metaphor.narrativeArc: The module progresses through Simba's journey, starting with his birth (component mounting), his carefree 'Hakuna Matata' phase (ignoring updates/cleanup), his realization and return to responsibility (implementing cleanup effects), and finally the restoration of the Pride Lands (healthy component lifecycle), mirroring the stages and lessons of React component lifecycles.

problems: Components not responding to prop/state changes

chapters.title: The Circle of Life
chapters.focus: Introduces component mounting and the overall lifecycle concept.

chapters.title: The Hakuna Matata Problem
chapters.focus: Demonstrates memory leaks due to missing cleanup functions in useEffect.

chapters.title: Remember Who You Are
chapters.focus: Explains the importance and implementation of useEffect with cleanup.

chapters.title: The Two Kingdoms
chapters.focus: Compares applications with and without proper lifecycle management and cleanup.

chapters.title: The Cycle is Complete
chapters.focus: Summarizes the complete component lifecycle and the benefits of proper management.
